author: S Vijay Kumar
S Prasad
text:
A day after three girls of the SVS College of Naturopathy and Yoga Science in Bangaram in Villupuram were found dead inside a well near the institution, Revenue officials sealed the college and picked up the son of the college’s administrator and two hostel wardens for questioning.

The parents of the girls suspected foul play and expressed the fear that the students could have been killed and their bodies dumped in the well as they had confronted the management about monetary exploitation some months ago.

They demanded that the post-mortem be conducted in Chennai to ensure that local doctors were not influenced. In a related development, political party leaders, including VCK chief Thol Thirumavalavan and Bharatiya Janata Party State unit president Tamilisai Soundarajan, have demanded a judicial inquiry into the incident. While senior police officers refused to comment, it is learnt that they have registered a case under IPC Sections 384 (extortion) and 306 (abetment to suicide) and provisions of the TN Prohibition of Harassment Act.

College sealed; administrator’s son and hostel wardens picked up for questioning
title: Parents allege foul play in T.N. girls’ death
